metadata.title: CVE-2021-37159 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
hso_free_net_device in drivers/net/usb/hso.c in the Linux kernel through5.13.4 calls unregister_netdev without checking for the NETREG_REGISTEREDstate, leading to a use-after-free and a double free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37159` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-lowlatency - 4.4.0-223.256
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-163-generic - 4.15.0-163.171~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-163-generic - 4.15.0-163.171~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-163-lowlatency - 4.15.0-163.171~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-kvm - 4.4.0-1104.113
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-aws - 4.4.0-1139.153
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1116-aws - 4.15.0-1116.123~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1127-azure - 4.15.0-1127.140~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1112-gcp - 4.15.0-1112.126~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1084-oracle - 4.15.0-1084.92~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-223.256').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-163.171~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.113').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.153').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1116.123~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1127.140~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1112.126~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1084.92~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
